reviews.sentence: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and the beds are comfortable. We did not hear anyone around us even when we were awake but saw room service trays out next door in the morning. Free wifi but no hassle to get the password. Our room did not have a mini fridge. Overnight parking for the hotel stay was an additional 22 night on top of what we had already paid. It was just an unexpected amount. There was some construction but it was well managed unheard and out of the way.
Good. He gentlemen that checked us in was so awesome. Forced valet bc our dodge pickup and charged for an oversized vehicle.
Overpriced parking and food. Staff Was Excellent. No Fn Free Wi Fi For 300 stay and 360 an night parking and 800 food bill for crappy food.

Not Hilton Quailty No Fridge No Microwave. Took about 40 minutes to checkout and get a receipt only two people at front desk but 50 people waiting. Parking cost for hotel guest and is a ridiculous amount at 28 a day. No fridge in room no microwave in room while this is standard even in 2 and 3 star hotels. Coffee machine in room has two sugar packs total four would have been reasonable. Lots of people not staying at the hotel congregate in the lobby areas nightly.

Poor stay. The alarms clock and one lamp did not work at all. The TV kept turning off because the plug in the wall was loose. The parking is difficult for larger vehicles has to be less than 6 feet. The bathroom was clean but extremely small for the amount of money the room was.

The proximity to downtown and room size are the only redeeming qualities of the hotel. The parking is limited and expensive 28 a night for guests. Hotel is outdated. A 25 star at best. In need of repair. Employees never said thank you how was your stay was everything ok or even thank you. Bed was the worst I have slept in.

Overpriced and underwhelming. For a supposed upscale hotel we were quite underwhelmed. Very spotty internet service highly inconvenient and ridiculously expensive parking and a less than helpful concierge. There are much better options even if you need to stay in the general area.

Would do it again. The room was very comfortable and cozy. Good shower pressure. How the selfparking worked was n’t explained properly. Ended up paying 60 for keeping my car at the parking lot for two days when I was staying at the hotel the parking lot was for.

Nasty rooms and 30 parking. The parking is 30 just to park for the night. This should be mentioned when booking. Had to switch rooms because of hair all in the bed and shower. The restaurant food is good and the lobby atmosphere was great.

Pay for the room but not a parking spot. The hotel itself was nice. FYI they charge you to park your vehicle at the hotel even if you are paying for a room there. SO RIDICULOUS. BUT they had no parking available there so we had to park elsewhere. They did refund what we paid because we did not park there and had to pay elsewhere. I just think its crazy that you have to pay to park there if you are paying to stay there and they do not even have enough room to park all their guests.

Dragon Con. This is by far my favorite place to be during Dragon Con. I am only hopeful that one day I ’l manage to snag a reservation so I can actually stay here during the event. It ’s a great layout and place. They really went above and beyond with the Jurassic Park theme. I really enjoyed it. Only problem I have is not being able to get in to stay haha.

Very hard to find parking. Self parking lot full valet parking full. We had to park out of Hilton property. The AC had to be changed to 50 so we could get a decent temperature in the room. Either the AC is broken or the thermostat is not working. I ’d recommend staying at another 4 star hotel. One that actually seems like it.
Very Beautiful. Nice hotel at the center of Atlanta. Very spacious good internet and cable. The restaurants are nice but very pricey. Walking distance to the Olympic park.

Great but Expensive. Spent the weekend here during Pride along with my wife. Overall it was a good experience and I would consider staying here again. The Pros Friendly Staff the front desk and throughout the hotel Was impressed with the number of options for working out which is very important as my wife and I are both in the military. There ’s a nice sized gym with good working equipment and outdoor track and also outdoor basketball and tennis courts. Room was smaller than I expected but very comfortable quiet. Location was perfect for our needs as Marta is literally across the street. We appreciated being able to leave our car in the parking garage and travel across Atlanta through Marta. The Cons Parking lot fills quickly and is expensive 30 a day on top of paying for your room. There ’s no pool which is hard to believe for a hotel this size. No one will tell you that. We had to ask after failing to find it. Elevator wait times can add up during busy times. Rooms were on the high size relative to size and what you have to pay for parking. Bottom Line. Great hotel for if your attending a conference there or passing through on business. Not economical for the family traveling on a budget.

The location was excellent but there was too much congestion at the entrance of the hotel which is due to valet parking self parking and regular drop off and pickup. Management should look into addressing this.

Excellent. Friendly staff. Parking is horrible. Second night self park was all filled. After a volleyball tournament you want to just be able to come back and crash. And the price for parking is just nuts down there.

Visit. Jefrey valet parking was great his a really good guy excellent service work hard every day to help people his very efficient doing his job Jefrey love to work with people I will definitely visit again.

Good property Parking is a mess. Good experience with bellman and checkin desk. Room is nicely appointed with great water pressure. Executive breakfast room on rooftop is a little oversubscribed with seating at a premium. But the valet parking is a mess. Courteous crew but no process or means of handling morning and evening rush. Sunday morning wait was 30 minutes. Manager was apologetic and offered to refund parking charge. But I would rather have my car in a timely fashion. Need to staff up to handle the surges.

Customer service was great the only issue that I had was parking it was 32 a night but parking was not always available. My last night there I had to park at a different location. The location of the hotel is a busy area but you are central to everything in Atlanta.

Good. We got one night for 100 USD great price for Hilton in Atlanta. Otherwise nothing special. No Wi Fi for hotel guests. You have to buy it. That was quite disappointing. Some members of personnel not English speaking. And also you have to buy parking place for 32 USD per night.

Great Introduction. Mike M Was so great. We just arrived and he greeted us and helped us load our belongings from the self parking lot. He was very personable and made my husband and I feel very welcomed right away. I look forward seeing what the rest of the stay brings.
